sections.name: Saurian Worldwatcher
sections.text:
The longest-lived saurians favor introspection and take the long view of things—though this thoughtfulness should not be mistaken for weakness. Other saurians defer to worldwatchers' experience.

Recall Knowledge - Humanoid (Society): DC 40

sections.name: Saurian
Saurian Allies
sections.text: Saurians' immense physical strength and incredible longevity make them natural stewards of other powerful creatures such as dinosaurs and mammoths. However, they would never call these creatures “domesticated,” a concept they find particularly reprehensible.

sections.name: Saurians on Golarion
sections.text: Garund, with its warm tropical climes and epic mountain ranges, hosts the largest populations of saurians around the Inner Sea, but explorers claim that southern Arcadia is home to even more. Saurians have also been reported dwelling in vaults throughout the Darklands.

Enormous tyrannosaurus-humanoids, saurians are ancient beings who predate the rise of humans and dwell in the world's primeval jungles. While the saurians presented here are evil, saurians of all alignments exist.

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Dinosaur
traits.text: These reptiles have survived from prehistoric times.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

automatic_abilities.name: Raptor Jaw Disarm
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature makes a melee Strike against the worldwatcher but misses;
automatic_abilities.effect: The worldwatcher breaks the triggering creature's limb or weapon. If the triggering Strike was an unarmed attack, the triggering creature takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and becomes clumsy 1 until the limb is reset (an Interact action with the manipulate trait). If the triggering Strike was a weapon Strike, the weapon takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage.

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: naginata +35 [+30/+25] (deadly d8, magical, reach 20 feet, versatile P), Damage 3d8+19 slashing plus stunning blow

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: jaws +33 [+28/+23] (deadly d12, magical, reach 15 feet), Damage 3d10+17 piercing

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: fist +35 [+31/+27] (agile, finesse, magical, reach 10 feet), Damage 4d10+19 bludgeoning plus stunning blow

offensive_actions.name: Melee
offensive_actions.text: tail +35 [+31/+27] (agile, finesse, magical, reach 10 feet, trip), Damage 3d6+19 bludgeoning

offensive_actions.name: Ranged
offensive_actions.text: javelin +35 [+30/+25] (thrown 30 feet), Damage 1d6+19 piercing

offensive_actions.name: Primal Innate Spells
offensive_actions.text: DC 40; 9thfiery body, summon animal (dinosaur only), volcanic eruption; 4thair walk; 3rdanimal vision (at will; dinosaurs only); 2ndanimal messenger; Constant(2nd)speak with animals

offensive_actions.name: Boneshaking Roar
offensive_actions.text: The saurian worldwatcher bellows, evoking the power of the primordial world. Non-dinosaur creatures within 30 feet take 10d6 sonic damage (DC 38 basic Fortitude save). On a failed save, a creature is also slowed 2 for 1 round (stunned 1d4 on a critical failure). The saurian can't use Boneshaking Roar again for 1d4 rounds.

offensive_actions.name: Stunning Blow
offensive_actions.text: Whenever the worldwatcher hits a creature with their fist or naginata Strike, that creature must succeed at a DC 39 Fortitude save or be stunned 1 (stunned 3 on a critical hit).
